page.title: 14 Doxey Marshes,W.Stafford.
page.content: Doxey Marshes is designated a site of special scientific importance, because there is an abundance of wild- life.Doxey Marshes is a wetland area a short distance from the town centre. People go there to look at the wildlife and to enjoy a pleasant walk through the marshes.The marshes cover 360 acres and the Nature Reserve covers 171 acres.On a busy weekend 3000 to 4000 people go to the marshes.There are over 140 different species of bird. The Marshes are a popular breeding place for some of the birds. There are also butterflies and small mammals who live on the marshes.
